intro: Cryptandra bifida, commonly known as the two-lobed cryptandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and distinctive flower clusters. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually white or pink and are pollinated by insects. Cryptandra bifida is an important component of local ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various native fauna.
